content.description: A good warmup for the Ridge Area. Climbs the center of the west face of the Isosceles Boulder.
content.location: This is in the Ridge Area.

content.description: Move from one side of the boulder to the other starting on a good jug, then climb left, and enter a cave-like experience as you reach through and grab good holds that will bring you up to the apex of the boulder that meets the cliff band.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter pad to prevent you from hitting the cliffband behind you.
content.location: It is on the cliffband side of the boulder.

content.description:
This is the Shacks' version of

Atari

at the Happy's!! Looks classic, climbs okay. Isosceles ascends the triangular-looking south face that is obvious from the parking lot.

Start by liebacking and heelhooking the right arete until it is possible to reach out left and sidepull the left arete. Do some cool double sidepulls until a committing throw to the apex (good). Mantle straight up over the south face (don't escape out right).
content.protection: A very GOOD spotter, if you fall you risk bouncing off the ledge and falling even further down left into talus, especially if your heel hook blows.
content.location: This is on the Ridge, look for big, triangle-shaped face.
